definitions.definition: showing you do not think that you are as important as other people

examples.text: Be humble enough to learn from your mistakes.
my humble tribute to this great man
She was very humble and apologetic.
an amazing man who makes you feel quite humble
She felt humble and grateful but couldn't put her feelings into words.
She's a loving, kind and humble woman.

definitions.definition: used to suggest that you are not as important as other people, but in a way that is not sincere or not very serious

examples.text: **In my humble opinion**, you were in the wrong.
**My humble apologies**. I did not understand.

definitions.definition: having a low rank or social position

examples.text: the daughter of a humble shopkeeper
She was the daughter of a humble carpenter and a washerwoman.
He was a man who had risen from humble origins through hard work and good fortune.
He is intensely proud of his humble background.
He had worked his way up from humble beginnings.
a man of fairly humble origins

definitions.definition: not large or special in any way

examples.text: The company has worked its way up from humble beginnings to become the market leader.
Most of us have never considered the humble potato as a precious gift from nature.

definitions.definition: to say and show that you are sorry for a mistake that you made

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin humilis ‘low, lowly’, from humus ‘ground’.
